basics.name: Gerardo Rivera Tello
basics.label: Atmospheric Science Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: I am currently studying for a Ph.D. in the Atmospheric Sciences Department at the University of Hawaii. My research insterest are in applying deep learning to gain insight on El Niño Southern Oscillation (ENSO) diversity.

work.company: School of Ocean and Earth Sciences Technology (SOES)
work.summary: Graduate research assistant working on ENSO in Dr. Christina Karamperidou's group
highlights: Climate simulations of past ENSO extreme events
Monitoring of ENSO conditions by processing and automating real time data in a high performance computing Linux cluster
Research on deep learning methods applied to ENSO forecasting

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013
